results.title: Projekt No. 5
results.brief_description: This guide to research and access to local video artist’s work is intended as an important resource for all curator’s, galleries, students and art lovers with a desire to better understand and appreciate a thriving cultural medium. Contains artworks which have been shown in a gallery context from established, mid career and emerging artists from Australia. The artists included on this tape are: Sue Dodd, Emil Goh, Daniel von Sturmer, Meri Blazevski, Leslie Eastman, and Philip Brophy. Sponsored by the City of Melbourne, The Victorian College of the Arts and the Kings Artist Run Space.

results.title: Projector test film
results.brief_description: THE PRINTS FOR THIS TITLE HAVE BEEN CHOSEN AS TEST PRINTS FOR THOSE CLIENTS (OR POTENTIAL CLIENTS) OF THE CINEMEDIA ACCESS COLLECTION WHO WISH TO TEST THEIR PROJECTOR. ADVISE CLIENT THAT THEY SHOULD NOT SCREEN ANY OTHER FILMS UNTIL THEY HAVE PLAYED THE PRINT THROUGH IN ITS ENTIRETY AND ARE CERTAIN THE PROJECTOR IS IN GOOD WORKING ORDER. FOR ANY FURTHER DETAIL PLEASE CONTACT EITHER DESPATCH STAFF OR THE MANAGER OF THE 16MM COLLECTION REVIEW PROJECT. AC 6/11/1997

results.title: Projective generation of conics (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: College Geometry Project, University of Minnesota, Bob Nelson and Allen Downs
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Introduces the eccentricity definition, then focuses on projective definitions devoid of metric notion implying the construction of a conic by straight edge alone. Shows methods of construction developed by Pascal, Malaurin, Braikenridge, Poncelet and Steiner. The logical relationship between the methods is demonstrated.
results.creator_credit_for_label: College Geometry Project, University of Minnesota, Bob Nelson and Allen Downs
results.description:

Introduces the eccentricity definition, then focuses on projective definitions devoid of metric notion implying the construction of a conic by straight edge alone. Shows methods of construction developed by Pascal, Malaurin, Braikenridge, Poncelet and Steiner. The logical relationship between the methods is demonstrated.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Geometry”.
Introduces the eccentricity definition, then focuses on projective definitions devoid of metric notion implying the construction of a conic by straight edge alone. Shows methods of construction developed by Pascal, Malaurin, Braikenridge, Poncelet and Steiner. The logical relationship between the methods is demonstrated.

results.title: Projections for the future: a behavior model
results.brief_description: Discusses the use and misuse of operant conditioning as a social organizer. Also depicts one social system that might result from the application of operant conditioning methods. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.
